main event: On October 28, 1959, in Ozona, Texas, seven silver and red objects with two red projections were observed for 7 hours by both civilian and military sources. The objects were observed using binoculars and a surveyor's transit, and their positions corresponded to the location of Venus during the sighting.
interesting points: Seven unidentified objects were observed over a 7-hour period, indicating prolonged and consistent sightings.
The objects were described as silver and red with two red projections, exhibiting unusual and unexplained characteristics.
Observations were made using binoculars and a surveyor's transit, suggesting a detailed and thorough examination of the objects.
The positions of the objects corresponded to the location of Venus, raising questions about the nature of the sightings.
A phone call from a witness in Texas provided detailed azimuth and elevation information about the objects' movements.
sighted object: seven silver and red objects with two red projections
